Title: Step Pyramid of Djoser
Notes: 15 gates

Title: Enclosure and Unfinished Step Pyramid of Sekhemhet
Notes: unfinished, no limestone casing (Verner mentions limestone casing) , "probably inyended to rise about 70 m (230 ft), in seven steps - higher than Djoser's." (Lehner, 94)

Title: Pyramid of Nebka? Unfinished Pyramid
Notes: debate over whether this is Pyramid of Nebka

Title: Pyramid of Khaba
Notes: began as step pyramid

Title: Meidum Pyramid
Notes: limestone casing, causeway 200m, Cult Pyramid - 26 m, 75 degree angle (Verner)

Title: Bent Pyramid
Notes: limestone casing, Cult Pyramid - 52 m side, 44 degree angle, 26 m height

Title: Red Pyramid
Notes: red granite false door, no Cult Pyramid, causeway not completed

Relationship: Royal Mother (thought to be wife of Sneferu, mother of Khufu)
Title: Queen Hetepheres I - Tomb G 7000x
Pyramid of Khufu/Great Pyramid of Giza
Notes: Cult Pyramid - 21.75m (base), 51 degree angle, 13.80 m height, limestone core and casing, likely moves to Giza for the space to build a large pyramid where there was a supply of limestone (Verner) extensive building - king chamber, queen chamber, mortuary and valley temple, boat pits

Relationship: Royal Mother, Wife of Sneferu, Wife of Khufu
Title: Queen Meretities I - Pyramid G 1-a
Notes: core of limestone, includes temple, chapel, boat pit

Title: Pyramid G 1-b
Notes: Queen unknown, similar to GI-a

Relationship: Wife of Khufu, Mother of Khafre?
Title: Queen Henutsen - Pyramid G 1-c
Notes: casing unfinished, no boat pit, includes temple

Title: Pyramid of Djedefre
Notes: Cult Pyramid - 10.5 m base, 65 degree angle

Title: Pyramid of Khafre
Notes: bottom course made of granite

Title: Unknown Tombs of Khamerembti I and Heknuhezet
Pyramid of Menkaure
Notes: bottom courses made of red granite

Title: Khamerenebti II and Rekhetre - Rock Cut Tombs
Mastabat el-Faroun; Tomb of Shepseskaf
Notes: domed roof, granite base, causeway built to 3m

Title: Pyramid of Khentkaus (Mother of Neferirkare)
Notes: slope of 52 degrees, black granite, red grainite, limestone pieces found

Title: Pyramid of Userkaf
Enclosure Wall Dimensions (m): Userkaf enclosure wall, height total is 16 cubits/8.4m x width (at base) 8 cubits/4.18m, with rounded top and 8.33 degree angle to sides, interior square pillars in courtyard are reconstructed as 4.25m, with .95m architrave (5.2m tall total), 1.1 wide, holding a .80m peristyle roof around the court; satellite pyramid measures 20.96m square, original height of 14m, height of sanctuary on E side of pyramid 6.8m high
Notes: cased with white limestone

Title: Pyramid of Sahure
Notes: limestone casing, limestone core

Title: Pyramid of Neferirkare
Notes: 56 m (unfinished step pyramid core) vs 72 m planned,  turned into true period from step pyramid, casing not added, height for true pyramid unknown, Verner says that successor Niuserre had to work on finishing this pyramid, as it was not complete at king's death.  But that the casing "was not completed, and they valley temple and causeway were also never built" (2001: 297)

Title: Pyramid of Khentkaus II (Mother of Neferefre and Niuserre)
Pyramid of Raneferef or Neferefre
Notes: pyramid unfinished became mastaba with gravel roof terrace, limestone casing blocks

Title: Pyramid of Niuserre
Notes: white limestone casing. Niuserre finished pyramids of Neferirkare and Khentkawes

Title: Niuserre Solar Temple
Notes: Base of obelisk  is 19m tall, obelisk on top is 37.5, with total height at 56.5m.

Title: Lepsius 25 (XXV/1)
Notes: initially meant to be pyramid turned into mastaba

Title: Lepsius 25 (XXV/2)
Notes: initially meant to be pyramid turned into mastaba

Title: Lepsius 24 (XXIV) - Pyramid for Reptynub
Notes: limestone casing

Title: Lepsius 29 (XXIX) - Headless Pyramid
Notes: debate over owner of Pyramid, Merikare? Menkauhor? - Sullivan used estimated height of 32 m based on height of Khendjer pyramid, with a similar base size

Title: Pyramid of Djedkare-Isesi
Notes: white limestone casing

Title: Pyramid of Unas
Enclosure Wall Dimensions (m): 2.62 m thick, probably similar in size to Teti (7m)
Notes: fine white limestone casing , red granite papyrus columns

Title: Unas Causeway
Notes: Causeway: ~4.5m high, ~6.8 wide at base, projected ~7.0 wide on top surface, interior open corridor 2.6m wide, 3.95/4m high, exterior walls are slightly slanted inward (5 degrees) ~720m in total length (Moussa and Labrousse 2002: fig. 2);

Title: Unas Valley Temple
Height (m): 9.75 (highest point of temple) 6.75 (height of lower level walls of temple)
Notes: doors heights (central door ~3m with a 1m high granite architrave and .8m wide granite doorjambs; side doors 2.75m high with 1m high granite architrave and .75m wide granite doorjambs).

Title: Pyramid of Teti
Notes: enclosure walls made of limestone, satellite pyramid 16 m

Title: Pyramid of Sesheshet (Mother of King Teti)
Notes: built near mastabas of Unas's wives Nebet and Khenut

Title: Pyramid of Iput I (Mother of Pepi I)
Notes: cased with white limestone

Title: Pyramid of Pepi I
Notes: cased with fine white limestone

Title: Pyramid of Merenre
Notes: cased with fine limestone, causeway 200m long, enclosure walls made of mudbrick

Title: Pyramid of Pepi II - Valley Temple
Height (m): upper level 5m, middle layer 5m, lower level 4.5m

Title: Queen Neith's Pyramid
Notes: satellite pyramid 5.25 m sq

Title: Pyramid of Ibi
Notes: casing not put in place, chapel made of mudbrick, core made of "small stones" (Lehner
